case_vignette: A 58-year-old man with type 2 diabetes mellitus comes to the emergency department because of a 2-day history of dysphagia and swelling in the neck and lower jaw. He has had tooth pain on the left side over the past week, which has made it difficult for him to sleep. Four weeks ago, he had a 3-day episode of flu-like symptoms, including sore throat, that resolved without treatment. He has a history of hypertension. Current medications include metformin and lisinopril. He appears distressed. He is 180 cm (5 ft 11 in) tall and weighs 100 kg (220 lbs); his BMI is 31.6 kg/m2. His temperature is 38.4°C (101.1°F), pulse is 90/min, and blood pressure is 110/80 mm Hg. Oral cavity examination shows a decayed lower left third molar with drainage of pus. There is submandibular and anterior neck tenderness and swelling. His leukocyte count is 15,600/mm3, platelet count is 300,000/mm3, and fingerstick blood glucose concentration is 250 mg/dL.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

I have type 2 diabetes and high blood pressure.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
No changes in my weight or appetite that I've noticed.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns?
Yes, the tooth pain on my left side has made it difficult for me to sleep.

I appear distressed because of my current symptoms.
Have you had any recent changes in your hearing or vision?
No changes in my hearing or vision.
Have you had any recent changes in your skin or rashes?
No skin changes or rashes.
Have you had any recent changes in your breathing or shortness of breath?
I haven't experienced any changes in my breathing or shortness of breath.
Have you had any recent changes in your urination or bowel movements?
I haven't noticed any changes in my urination or bowel movements.
Have you had any recent changes in your menstrual cycle?
I'm a man, so I don't have a menstrual cycle.
Have you had any recent changes in your sexual activity?
I haven't mentioned anything about changes in my sexual activity.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or eating habits?
No changes in appetite or eating habits recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your exercise routine?
